byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and JANE PERLEZ

abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping prepares to visit United States at a time when he is bedeviled by economic doubts and rising concern over his ambitious plan for governing; despite domestic issues and series of conflicts with the US, Xi is still seen as most powerful leader of Chinese Communist Party in generations, and he has shown no sign of retreating on policy initiatives.
lead_paragraph: The chill on the Chinese economy has eroded some of the sheen attached to Mr. Xi, and some analysts say he may want to project an especially strong image when holding talks in the United States.

headline.main: Xi Jinping of China Arriving in U.S. at Moment of Vulnerability
headline.print_headline: Chinese Leader Comes to U.S. Facing Fresh Economic Doubts

snippet: The chill on the Chinese economy has eroded some of the sheen attached to Mr. Xi, and some analysts say he may want to project an especially strong image when holding talks in the United States.
